
Eve intercepted a secret 5824371851894480524189683168062924551889328815148253143347021047568267222744187698571398361847561351437380129020779985956836107091636490668346611956238382 encrypted with RSA using a modulus generated from two Blum primes. Can you exploit this to recover the message?

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{1ua9syu3}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5824371851894480524189683168062924551889328815148253143347021047568267222744187698571398361847561351437380129020779985956836107091636490668346611956238382
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5994003582983350065219933112429082645647702593479885094234791397677733734069840485313153287824990102161170237726963239706002984229299026617828991013463829, e=5790609994152775315250812073625116657377526747073924064738037330373031280030673948574863018485438693304012673582806574117829964370048925122384984628824103
